trans-unit.source: Xenko 1.9 beta release notes
trans-unit.target: Xenko 1.9 beta release notes

trans-unit.source: Highlights
trans-unit.target: Highlights

trans-unit.source: Xenko 1.9 Beta introduces several major new features along with several relevant enhancements to existing features.
trans-unit.target: Xenko 1.9 Beta introduces several major new features along with several relevant enhancements to existing features.

trans-unit.source: We are excited to offer three new game templates to speed up your game design time, a brand new script editor as well as expanded copy-paste functionality.
trans-unit.target: We are excited to offer three new game templates to speed up your game design time, a brand new script editor as well as expanded copy-paste functionality.

trans-unit.source: The last major new feature is our new Navigation Mesh system.
trans-unit.target: The last major new feature is our new Navigation Mesh system.

trans-unit.source: Game Templates
trans-unit.target: Game Templates

trans-unit.source: We have added several templates packed with a lot of functionality to help you kickstart your games. Choose from:
trans-unit.target: We have added several templates packed with a lot of functionality to help you kickstart your games. Choose from:

trans-unit.source: First Person Shooter
trans-unit.target: First Person Shooter

trans-unit.source: Third Person Platformer
trans-unit.target: Third Person Platformer

trans-unit.source: Top-View RPG
trans-unit.target: Top-View RPG

trans-unit.source: All of them come with basic camera and player functionality found in most games of their respective genres. They also have many production-quality assets so you can easily try different features on your own.
trans-unit.target: All of them come with basic camera and player functionality found in most games of their respective genres. They also have many production-quality assets so you can easily try different features on your own.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the game templates, the New Game project now includes optional packages with all the assets we used to build the samples. Unlike the game templates which are trimmed down, the optional packages include ALL assets, including some which are not used by any Xenko sample.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the game templates, the New Game project now includes optional packages with all the assets we used to build the samples. Unlike the game templates which are trimmed down, the optional packages include ALL assets, including some which are not used by any Xenko sample.

trans-unit.source: Script Editor
trans-unit.target: Script Editor

trans-unit.source: To ease friction from switching back and forth between the Game Studio and your IDE, we’ve built a new Script Editor. Relying fully on Visual Studio is no longer necessary because you can now edit your code directly within the Game Studio itself. You’ll get full syntax highlighting, auto-completion, live diagnostics and even the ability to auto-reload C# files and projects that changed on your hard drive due to changes in your external editor (e.g., Visual Studio).
trans-unit.target: To ease friction from switching back and forth between the Game Studio and your IDE, we’ve built a new Script Editor. Relying fully on Visual Studio is no longer necessary because you can now edit your code directly within the Game Studio itself. You’ll get full syntax highlighting, auto-completion, live diagnostics and even the ability to auto-reload C# files and projects that changed on your hard drive due to changes in your external editor (e.g., Visual Studio).

trans-unit.source: In fact, expect:
trans-unit.target: In fact, expect:

trans-unit.source: Highlight, auto-completion and live diagnostics is available in the Xenko API, your own game code and libraries that you use
trans-unit.target: Highlight, auto-completion and live diagnostics is available in the Xenko API, your own game code and libraries that you use

trans-unit.source: Auto-reload C# scripts and C# project changes that happened in the background
trans-unit.target: Auto-reload C# scripts and C# project changes that happened in the background

trans-unit.source: A Visual Studio like experience for all your code editing!
trans-unit.target: A Visual Studio like experience for all your code editing!

trans-unit.source: We had some help from Microsoft’s .NET compiler, Roslyn, so Xenko users will also receive the full benefit of all the latest features of .NET. Adding a Rosyln-based Script Editor makes it easier to keep up with the latest C# updates.
trans-unit.target: We had some help from Microsoft’s .NET compiler, Roslyn, so Xenko users will also receive the full benefit of all the latest features of .NET. Adding a Rosyln-based Script Editor makes it easier to keep up with the latest C# updates.

trans-unit.source: Using the Xenko Script Editor is fairly straightforward. Just follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: Using the Xenko Script Editor is fairly straightforward. Just follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Create a new project/game in Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Create a new project/game in Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Add a script in Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Add a script in Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Edit the script in Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Edit the script in Game Studio

trans-unit.source: C# scripts saved on Visual Studio side (or any text editor, for that matter) will automatically be updated in Game Studio without reloading. Same goes for project changes (.csproj): new scripts will appear automatically upon saving. GameStudio will automatically listen for file changes on the hard drive and update them live, or ask you what to do in case of conflicts.
trans-unit.target: C# scripts saved on Visual Studio side (or any text editor, for that matter) will automatically be updated in Game Studio without reloading. Same goes for project changes (.csproj): new scripts will appear automatically upon saving. GameStudio will automatically listen for file changes on the hard drive and update them live, or ask you what to do in case of conflicts.

trans-unit.source: Under the hood, Rosyln is the underlying technology that can process your Xenko source code. But we didn’t stop there! We were fortunate to find AvalonEdit, which provided us what we wanted for the visual appearance of the UI aspect of the Xenko script editor. We also integrated RoslynPad, which connects Roslyn and AvalonEdit together.
trans-unit.target: Under the hood, Rosyln is the underlying technology that can process your Xenko source code. But we didn’t stop there! We were fortunate to find AvalonEdit, which provided us what we wanted for the visual appearance of the UI aspect of the Xenko script editor. We also integrated RoslynPad, which connects Roslyn and AvalonEdit together.

trans-unit.source: Navigation Meshes
trans-unit.target: Navigation Meshes

trans-unit.source: In Xenko 1.9β, you can create a navigation mesh powered by Recast and Detour with real-time feedback directly in the Xenko GameStudio! The navigation mesh is especially useful for RPGs or top-down strategy games, as you can use it to guide characters through complex scenes. The real-time feedback makes it easy to adjust and conveniently customize AI movement and the dimensions of the navigation mesh itself. The green outline of Xenko’s Navigation Mesh shows where the AI comes into play and where the colliders are set.
trans-unit.target: In Xenko 1.9β, you can create a navigation mesh powered by Recast and Detour with real-time feedback directly in the Xenko GameStudio! The navigation mesh is especially useful for RPGs or top-down strategy games, as you can use it to guide characters through complex scenes. The real-time feedback makes it easy to adjust and conveniently customize AI movement and the dimensions of the navigation mesh itself. The green outline of Xenko’s Navigation Mesh shows where the AI comes into play and where the colliders are set.

trans-unit.source: In the videos, you can see how the AI navigates the level using the logic within the navigation mesh, and how the colliders will automatically be set in real-time. Of course, you can script AI movement manually, too.
trans-unit.target: In the videos, you can see how the AI navigates the level using the logic within the navigation mesh, and how the colliders will automatically be set in real-time. Of course, you can script AI movement manually, too.

trans-unit.source: Copy & Paste Functionality Expanded
trans-unit.target: Copy & Paste Functionality Expanded

trans-unit.source: In the past we only supported copy and pasting of assets, but now you can copy-paste pretty much anything in the Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: In the past we only supported copy and pasting of assets, but now you can copy-paste pretty much anything in the Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: Any entities in a scene are now copyable, as well as any sprites of a sprite sheet, UI elements, or even a single property in the property grid! For instance, you can copy a list and perform any of the following operations.
trans-unit.target: Any entities in a scene are now copyable, as well as any sprites of a sprite sheet, UI elements, or even a single property in the property grid! For instance, you can copy a list and perform any of the following operations.

trans-unit.source: Insert it into another list at various positions, for example:
trans-unit.target: Insert it into another list at various positions, for example:

trans-unit.source: Copy and insert into the list (by pasting at a list item level).*
trans-unit.target: Copy and insert into the list (by pasting at a list item level).*

trans-unit.source: Copy and append to a list, for example, append it to the end of the list.
trans-unit.target: Copy and append to a list, for example, append it to the end of the list.

trans-unit.source: Copy and replace the whole list.
trans-unit.target: Copy and replace the whole list.

trans-unit.source: A bit more difficult to explain, but perhaps easier to show than write about is copy and replace at an item level. This action (shown in the video below) will remove the item (at its position in the list) and insert the copied ones starting at the same position of the item in the list. In our example below, the copy replace starts from Item 2 in List 2:
trans-unit.target: A bit more difficult to explain, but perhaps easier to show than write about is copy and replace at an item level. This action (shown in the video below) will remove the item (at its position in the list) and insert the copied ones starting at the same position of the item in the list. In our example below, the copy replace starts from Item 2 in List 2:

trans-unit.source: Some information about copying entities and prefabs:
trans-unit.target: Some information about copying entities and prefabs:

trans-unit.source: An entire hierarchy of entities can be copied from one scene or prefab to another scene or prefab. Prefab instance will keep their reference to the source prefab as illustrated in the following example:
trans-unit.target: An entire hierarchy of entities can be copied from one scene or prefab to another scene or prefab. Prefab instance will keep their reference to the source prefab as illustrated in the following example:

source.g: The prefab “MyHero” is copied into the scene. Links to the prefab are maintained.

target.g: The prefab “MyHero” is copied into the scene. Links to the prefab are maintained.

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to copy a component from an entity and paste it into another entity.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to copy a component from an entity and paste it into another entity.

trans-unit.source: Any absolutely any property that can be serialized can be copied. You can copy something from one scene to another scene, from a sub-element in one scene to another scene and even from a scene to a text file, back and forth as needed. You can also copy simple values in the property grid (e.g., primitives such as int, vector3, string…) between separate Game Studio instances if that is something you find practical and useful.
trans-unit.target: Any absolutely any property that can be serialized can be copied. You can copy something from one scene to another scene, from a sub-element in one scene to another scene and even from a scene to a text file, back and forth as needed. You can also copy simple values in the property grid (e.g., primitives such as int, vector3, string…) between separate Game Studio instances if that is something you find practical and useful.

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example of copying between scripts and transform entities in the GameStudio Property Grid:
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example of copying between scripts and transform entities in the GameStudio Property Grid:

trans-unit.source: .NET Standard
trans-unit.target: .NET Standard

trans-unit.source: Starting with Xenko 1.9, shared Game assemblies will be created using .NET Standard rather than PCL.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Xenko 1.9, shared Game assemblies will be created using .NET Standard rather than PCL.

trans-unit.source: It offers many advantages: much better API surface for the developer, improved forward and backward compatibility, reduced fragmentation, finer-grained modularity of the framework, easier to write cross-platform apps, more frequent updates, etc.
trans-unit.target: It offers many advantages: much better API surface for the developer, improved forward and backward compatibility, reduced fragmentation, finer-grained modularity of the framework, easier to write cross-platform apps, more frequent updates, etc.

trans-unit.source: Newly created applications will target .NET Standard 1.4, but users are of course free to target a different version. Also, your existing PCL projects will still work as is, but we recommend you to update your projects to .NET Standard!
trans-unit.target: Newly created applications will target .NET Standard 1.4, but users are of course free to target a different version. Also, your existing PCL projects will still work as is, but we recommend you to update your projects to .NET Standard!

trans-unit.source: Assembly Reloading
trans-unit.target: Assembly Reloading

trans-unit.source: Iterating on code is very important. So far, Xenko was supporting changes in scripts: as soon as you saved any C# file, Game Studio was offering to recompile and reload the assembly with the updated scripts. If there is an error loading the type, you can still edit other part of the asset, save it back while preserving the parts that could not be loaded.
trans-unit.target: Iterating on code is very important. So far, Xenko was supporting changes in scripts: as soon as you saved any C# file, Game Studio was offering to recompile and reload the assembly with the updated scripts. If there is an error loading the type, you can still edit other part of the asset, save it back while preserving the parts that could not be loaded.

trans-unit.source: In this version, we generalized the approach so that any type embedded in your assets can be reloaded! As a result, you can now implement your own classes for anything you want directly in your game or plugin assemblies, and keep editing them without restarting the Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: In this version, we generalized the approach so that any type embedded in your assets can be reloaded! As a result, you can now implement your own classes for anything you want directly in your game or plugin assemblies, and keep editing them without restarting the Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: This includes renderers, material features, and will soon be extensively used in new assets.
trans-unit.target: This includes renderers, material features, and will soon be extensively used in new assets.

trans-unit.source: Breaking changes
trans-unit.target: Breaking changes

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone and Windows Store Removed
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone and Windows Store Removed

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone and Windows Store platforms are both removed. Please use the newer Universal Windows Apps (UWP) instead. This platform was previously known as Windows 10. Projects will be automatically upgraded to reflect this change.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone and Windows Store platforms are both removed. Please use the newer Universal Windows Apps (UWP) instead. This platform was previously known as Windows 10. Projects will be automatically upgraded to reflect this change.

trans-unit.source: Also, we renamed preprocessor definition SILICONSTUDIO_PLATFORM_WINDOWS_RUNTIME into SILICONSTUDIO_PLATFORM_UWP.
trans-unit.target: Also, we renamed preprocessor definition SILICONSTUDIO_PLATFORM_WINDOWS_RUNTIME into SILICONSTUDIO_PLATFORM_UWP.

trans-unit.source: .NET Standard
trans-unit.target: .NET Standard

trans-unit.source: The switch to .NET Standard for newly created projects implies that:
trans-unit.target: The switch to .NET Standard for newly created projects implies that:

trans-unit.source: Runtime .NET framework requirement when distributing your projects is bumped from .NET 4.5 to .NET 4.6.1.
trans-unit.target: Runtime .NET framework requirement when distributing your projects is bumped from .NET 4.5 to .NET 4.6.1.

trans-unit.source: You need Visual Studio 2015 to open and compile newly created projects
trans-unit.target: You need Visual Studio 2015 to open and compile newly created projects

trans-unit.source: You can upgrade older projects to use .NET Standard using Visual Studio 2015 Update 3 (in project properties)
trans-unit.target: You can upgrade older projects to use .NET Standard using Visual Studio 2015 Update 3 (in project properties)

trans-unit.source: From version 1.9, we don't install prerequisites to compile PCL projects anymore. If you have somebody in your team still working on a project created with a previous version of Xenko on a fresh PC, please make them install Xenko 1.8 so that it installs the proper prerequisites (even if the project has been updated to a newer version of Xenko).
trans-unit.target: From version 1.9, we don't install prerequisites to compile PCL projects anymore. If you have somebody in your team still working on a project created with a previous version of Xenko on a fresh PC, please make them install Xenko 1.8 so that it installs the proper prerequisites (even if the project has been updated to a newer version of Xenko).

trans-unit.source: Asset Serialization
trans-unit.target: Asset Serialization

trans-unit.source: We changed how we serialize asset in YAML. We introduced new concepts that improve how we can track overrides between an archetype or a prefab and assets/entities inheriting from it. Although everything happens "under the hood", this is a actually a heavy change that might impact the upgrading of your project.
trans-unit.target: We changed how we serialize asset in YAML. We introduced new concepts that improve how we can track overrides between an archetype or a prefab and assets/entities inheriting from it. Although everything happens "under the hood", this is a actually a heavy change that might impact the upgrading of your project.

trans-unit.source: We removed asset upgrading for projects made with version 1.3 and below (released more than a year ago). It is possible that you experience some issues when upgrading a project made with versions 1.4 to 1.7, but you should properly be able to upgrade any project that uses version 1.8. However a few cases are not supported:
trans-unit.target: We removed asset upgrading for projects made with version 1.3 and below (released more than a year ago). It is possible that you experience some issues when upgrading a project made with versions 1.4 to 1.7, but you should properly be able to upgrade any project that uses version 1.8. However a few cases are not supported:

trans-unit.source: Dependency Properties of UI elements that are overridden from an UI library will be reset during upgrade. Therefore, properties such as Grid Column and Row will have to be manually restored.
trans-unit.target: Dependency Properties of UI elements that are overridden from an UI library will be reset during upgrade. Therefore, properties such as Grid Column and Row will have to be manually restored.

trans-unit.source: Some case of overriden materials in the material list of ModelComponent might be improperly upgraded.
trans-unit.target: Some case of overriden materials in the material list of ModelComponent might be improperly upgraded.

trans-unit.source: Dropping Support for Windows Store 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1
trans-unit.target: Dropping Support for Windows Store 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1

trans-unit.source: To properly support the .NET Standard 1.4 and offer our developers a more up-to-date and robust API, we decided to drop support for Windows Store 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1 platforms.
trans-unit.target: To properly support the .NET Standard 1.4 and offer our developers a more up-to-date and robust API, we decided to drop support for Windows Store 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1 platforms.

trans-unit.source: As Microsoft seems to be focusing on Universal Windows Platform (UWP), we’ve also decided it was best to refocus on more pertinent and relevant platforms for Xenko users. UWP was introduced with Windows 10, and a whole range of devices already support it.
trans-unit.target: As Microsoft seems to be focusing on Universal Windows Platform (UWP), we’ve also decided it was best to refocus on more pertinent and relevant platforms for Xenko users. UWP was introduced with Windows 10, and a whole range of devices already support it.

trans-unit.source: Of course, you are free to stick with Xenko 1.8 in case you have a project targeting one of those two platforms -- we know this is a big change, and we will make every effort to help our developers with this transition. We apologize for the inconvenience, and aim to bring you a top-notch .NET user experience!
trans-unit.target: Of course, you are free to stick with Xenko 1.8 in case you have a project targeting one of those two platforms -- we know this is a big change, and we will make every effort to help our developers with this transition. We apologize for the inconvenience, and aim to bring you a top-notch .NET user experience!

trans-unit.source: Just as a reminder, we already support Universal Windows Platform (UWP) on x86, x64 and ARM as of Xenko 1.8, which means games and apps developed with Xenko can be deployed on a whole range of Microsoft devices, including Xbox One. Until 1.9, this platform was named Windows10 in Xenko, but we took the liberty to rename it UWP to better match the official naming.
trans-unit.target: Just as a reminder, we already support Universal Windows Platform (UWP) on x86, x64 and ARM as of Xenko 1.8, which means games and apps developed with Xenko can be deployed on a whole range of Microsoft devices, including Xbox One. Until 1.9, this platform was named Windows10 in Xenko, but we took the liberty to rename it UWP to better match the official naming.

trans-unit.source: Changelog
trans-unit.target: Changelog

trans-unit.source: Version 1.9.0-beta
trans-unit.target: Version 1.9.0-beta

trans-unit.source: Release date 2016/11/24
trans-unit.target: Release date 2016/11/24

trans-unit.source: Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Enhancements

trans-unit.source: General
trans-unit.target: General

trans-unit.source: From now on, new projects are created as .NET Standard projects rather than PCL projects.
trans-unit.target: From now on, new projects are created as .NET Standard projects rather than PCL projects.

trans-unit.source: NuGet restore is automatically run on projects having a project.json file
trans-unit.target: NuGet restore is automatically run on projects having a project.json file

trans-unit.source: Bumped FBX SDK to 2017.0.1
trans-unit.target: Bumped FBX SDK to 2017.0.1

trans-unit.source: Mesh importing now supports ByEdge smoothing which was previously ignored. If you notice any difference with vertex normals for your models please check your FBX export settings.
trans-unit.target: Mesh importing now supports ByEdge smoothing which was previously ignored. If you notice any difference with vertex normals for your models please check your FBX export settings.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites installer will ask for UAC once instead of many times, and perform a silent installation for all of the prerequisites.
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites installer will ask for UAC once instead of many times, and perform a silent installation for all of the prerequisites.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Previously, when an EntityComponent (i.e. script) couldn't be loaded because game or plugin assembly didn't compile properly, we kept a Yaml representation of it so that it could be saved or reloaded after a code fix. Now we allow it to happen anywhere, so that you can use and/or implement custom classes for any type of the engine in your game/plugin.
trans-unit.target: Previously, when an EntityComponent (i.e. script) couldn't be loaded because game or plugin assembly didn't compile properly, we kept a Yaml representation of it so that it could be saved or reloaded after a code fix. Now we allow it to happen anywhere, so that you can use and/or implement custom classes for any type of the engine in your game/plugin.

trans-unit.source: Improve asset logs and errors to properly display failure/warning icon on all assets, including the one with icon-style thumbnails.
trans-unit.target: Improve asset logs and errors to properly display failure/warning icon on all assets, including the one with icon-style thumbnails.

trans-unit.source: Improve loading/refreshing of assets in the scene editor.
trans-unit.target: Improve loading/refreshing of assets in the scene editor.

trans-unit.source: Asset editors will display a * in the tab name when an asset is dirty.
trans-unit.target: Asset editors will display a * in the tab name when an asset is dirty.

trans-unit.source: Add editor for C# source code.
trans-unit.target: Add editor for C# source code.

trans-unit.source: C# files and .csproj files are automatically reloaded as they are modified on hard drive (using a Yes, Yes to All, No, No to All dialog).
trans-unit.target: C# files and .csproj files are automatically reloaded as they are modified on hard drive (using a Yes, Yes to All, No, No to All dialog).

trans-unit.source: C# files have their own undo/redo stack
trans-unit.target: C# files have their own undo/redo stack

trans-unit.source: Add a Save All button that saves both assets and source code files.
trans-unit.target: Add a Save All button that saves both assets and source code files.

trans-unit.source: The Game Studio now uses AvalonDock as docking system
trans-unit.target: The Game Studio now uses AvalonDock as docking system

trans-unit.source: Improve DPI support (#454 and #470)
trans-unit.target: Improve DPI support (#454 and #470)

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: Asset YAML serialization has been changed to handle overrides in collection in a better way. More scenario of overrides are now supported.
trans-unit.target: Asset YAML serialization has been changed to handle overrides in collection in a better way. More scenario of overrides are now supported.

trans-unit.source: SharpYaml has been integrated into our codebase as SiliconStudio.Core.Yaml. Most of the duplicated types have been merged back in the SiliconStudio.Core.Reflection.
trans-unit.target: SharpYaml has been integrated into our codebase as SiliconStudio.Core.Yaml. Most of the duplicated types have been merged back in the SiliconStudio.Core.Reflection.

trans-unit.source: Assets don't use a ~Base section nor a ~BasePart.
trans-unit.target: Assets don't use a ~Base section nor a ~BasePart.

trans-unit.source: Change Asset.Id to be of an AssetId type rather than Guid, to avoid invalid comparisons with other kind of ids.
trans-unit.target: Change Asset.Id to be of an AssetId type rather than Guid, to avoid invalid comparisons with other kind of ids.

trans-unit.source: Remove the Properties member of Package.
trans-unit.target: Remove the Properties member of Package.

trans-unit.source: Introduce a new assembly Assets.Quantum
trans-unit.target: Introduce a new assembly Assets.Quantum

trans-unit.source: Overrides of properties is now handled using Quantum instead of ShadowObject.
trans-unit.target: Overrides of properties is now handled using Quantum instead of ShadowObject.

trans-unit.source: Remove the asset diff/merge classes.
trans-unit.target: Remove the asset diff/merge classes.

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: DataSerializers are now generated in a file with .pdb information, so that the user can debug them.
trans-unit.target: DataSerializers are now generated in a file with .pdb information, so that the user can debug them.

trans-unit.source: Add Local offsets to procedural models.
trans-unit.target: Add Local offsets to procedural models.

trans-unit.source: EntityComponent now implements IIdentifiable and has an Id property.
trans-unit.target: EntityComponent now implements IIdentifiable and has an Id property.

trans-unit.source: Audio
trans-unit.target: Audio

trans-unit.source: Add SetRange support to AudioEmitterSoundController
trans-unit.target: Add SetRange support to AudioEmitterSoundController

trans-unit.source: Improve compilation speed of audio files
trans-unit.target: Improve compilation speed of audio files

trans-unit.source: Materials
trans-unit.target: Materials

trans-unit.source: Normal maps now have the option to Invert Y, supporting both textures where the green component is facing up or down
trans-unit.target: Normal maps now have the option to Invert Y, supporting both textures where the green component is facing up or down

trans-unit.source: Particles
trans-unit.target: Particles

trans-unit.source: Minor optimizations around vertex buffer building
trans-unit.target: Minor optimizations around vertex buffer building

trans-unit.source: Add StopEmitters() method to the particle system, which prevents new particles from spawning without pausing the entire system
trans-unit.target: Add StopEmitters() method to the particle system, which prevents new particles from spawning without pausing the entire system

trans-unit.source: Physics
trans-unit.target: Physics

trans-unit.source: Add Cone collider shape.
trans-unit.target: Add Cone collider shape.

trans-unit.source: Replace float with AngleSingle for MaxSlope of character controllers.
trans-unit.target: Replace float with AngleSingle for MaxSlope of character controllers.

trans-unit.source: Issues Fixed
trans-unit.target: Issues Fixed

trans-unit.source: General
trans-unit.target: General

trans-unit.source: UWP platform now uses UniversalWindowsPlatform 5.2.2 (was previously 5.0.0).
trans-unit.target: UWP platform now uses UniversalWindowsPlatform 5.2.2 (was previously 5.0.0).

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Fix many issues with property overrides.
trans-unit.target: Fix many issues with property overrides.

trans-unit.source: Fix many issues when setting/overriding materials in ModelComponent.
trans-unit.target: Fix many issues when setting/overriding materials in ModelComponent.

trans-unit.source: Asset logs were not properly sent forward to editor, resulting in an empty log for all assets.
trans-unit.target: Asset logs were not properly sent forward to editor, resulting in an empty log for all assets.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes there was a deadlock when compiling effects due to the way we were using the thread pool and task continuations.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes there was a deadlock when compiling effects due to the way we were using the thread pool and task continuations.

trans-unit.source: Fix performance issue that could occur when duplicating entities with the same name many times.
trans-unit.target: Fix performance issue that could occur when duplicating entities with the same name many times.

trans-unit.source: Fix 'Rename' menu entry when right-clicking a folder of the scene editor.
trans-unit.target: Fix 'Rename' menu entry when right-clicking a folder of the scene editor.

trans-unit.source: Fix crashes in the UI editor that could occur when deleting or moving an element.
trans-unit.target: Fix crashes in the UI editor that could occur when deleting or moving an element.

trans-unit.source: Fix crashes in sprite sheet editor that could occur when deleting, duplicating or moving sprites.
trans-unit.target: Fix crashes in sprite sheet editor that could occur when deleting, duplicating or moving sprites.

trans-unit.source: Fix sort order of assets in the asset view.
trans-unit.target: Fix sort order of assets in the asset view.

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: Fix tangents of imported meshes, when transforms are negative along some axes
trans-unit.target: Fix tangents of imported meshes, when transforms are negative along some axes

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Several issues with spot lights were fixed, including shadow maps
trans-unit.target: Several issues with spot lights were fixed, including shadow maps

trans-unit.source: Fix flickering of some materials when no ambient light is present
trans-unit.target: Fix flickering of some materials when no ambient light is present

trans-unit.source: Fix an issue on OpenGL that caused low frame rates when using post effects, due to blocking GPU-readback
trans-unit.target: Fix an issue on OpenGL that caused low frame rates when using post effects, due to blocking GPU-readback

trans-unit.source: Animation
trans-unit.target: Animation

trans-unit.source: Fix a bug where an empty animation clip caused a crash
trans-unit.target: Fix a bug where an empty animation clip caused a crash

trans-unit.source: Version 1.9.1-beta
trans-unit.target: Version 1.9.1-beta

trans-unit.source: Release date 2016/11/29
trans-unit.target: Release date 2016/11/29

trans-unit.source: Issues fixed
trans-unit.target: Issues fixed

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Moving or renaming an asset that has overridden properties (eg. a scene using prefabs) was loosing override information once saved.
trans-unit.target: Moving or renaming an asset that has overridden properties (eg. a scene using prefabs) was loosing override information once saved.

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Normal maps issue fixed where z-component was wrongly assumed to be 1 (it's now equal to sqrt(1 - x^2 - y^2))
trans-unit.target: Normal maps issue fixed where z-component was wrongly assumed to be 1 (it's now equal to sqrt(1 - x^2 - y^2))

trans-unit.source: Depth of Field halo around foreground objects issue resolved
trans-unit.target: Depth of Field halo around foreground objects issue resolved

trans-unit.source: Samples
trans-unit.target: Samples

trans-unit.source: Missing normal maps on some samples have been restored
trans-unit.target: Missing normal maps on some samples have been restored

trans-unit.source: Version 1.9.2-beta
trans-unit.target: Version 1.9.2-beta

trans-unit.source: Release date 2016/12/13
trans-unit.target: Release date 2016/12/13

trans-unit.source: Enhancements
trans-unit.target: Enhancements

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Maintaining ALT key down when dropping a prefab into a scene won't create a container entity for the prefab instance.
trans-unit.target: Maintaining ALT key down when dropping a prefab into a scene won't create a container entity for the prefab instance.

trans-unit.source: Creation of prefabs from entities that are already instances of other prefabs and contains overridden properties will maintain prefab links and overrides in the newly created prefab.
trans-unit.target: Creation of prefabs from entities that are already instances of other prefabs and contains overridden properties will maintain prefab links and overrides in the newly created prefab.

trans-unit.source: Issues fixed
trans-unit.target: Issues fixed

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Duplicating an entity that was linked to a prefab was not maintaining the prefab link to the copy in some scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Duplicating an entity that was linked to a prefab was not maintaining the prefab link to the copy in some scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Adding a new or existing package to a solution was causing a crash.
trans-unit.target: Adding a new or existing package to a solution was causing a crash.

trans-unit.source: Fix hashing of source files to detect if an source file has changed.
trans-unit.target: Fix hashing of source files to detect if an source file has changed.

trans-unit.source: Adding a component that requires unicity to a prefab when one of the instance already had an instance of this prefab was crashing.
trans-unit.target: Adding a component that requires unicity to a prefab when one of the instance already had an instance of this prefab was crashing.

trans-unit.source: Fix a crash that could occurs when removing an animation or a sound from an Animation Component or an Audio Emitter Component while the Game Studio was still compiling the asset.
trans-unit.target: Fix a crash that could occurs when removing an animation or a sound from an Animation Component or an Audio Emitter Component while the Game Studio was still compiling the asset.

trans-unit.source: Render stages are now properly re-evaluated when a property affecting rendering is modified (eg. casting shadows, adding transparency to a material...)
trans-unit.target: Render stages are now properly re-evaluated when a property affecting rendering is modified (eg. casting shadows, adding transparency to a material...)

trans-unit.source: Fix insert position when dropping multiple assets into a scene at the same time
trans-unit.target: Fix insert position when dropping multiple assets into a scene at the same time

trans-unit.source: Fix opening a scene from a package project that is not a game was crashing.
trans-unit.target: Fix opening a scene from a package project that is not a game was crashing.

trans-unit.source: Fix a crash that was occurring when adding a new Override in the GameSettings asset
trans-unit.target: Fix a crash that was occurring when adding a new Override in the GameSettings asset

trans-unit.source: Fix an issue when copy/pasting a component that requires unicity to an entity that already has one. Now the user will be correctly prompted whether this component should be replaced by the copy.
trans-unit.target: Fix an issue when copy/pasting a component that requires unicity to an entity that already has one. Now the user will be correctly prompted whether this component should be replaced by the copy.

trans-unit.source: Fix incorrect filter list of asset types in the asset view.
trans-unit.target: Fix incorrect filter list of asset types in the asset view.

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Fix an issue in the code detecting when a second component of the same type is added to an entity that should accept only one component of that type.
trans-unit.target: Fix an issue in the code detecting when a second component of the same type is added to an entity that should accept only one component of that type.

trans-unit.source: Spotlights with shadows bug fix where multiple spotlights would reference the wrong shadowmap.
trans-unit.target: Spotlights with shadows bug fix where multiple spotlights would reference the wrong shadowmap.

trans-unit.source: Normal maps property names changed and some shader crashes fixed.
trans-unit.target: Normal maps property names changed and some shader crashes fixed.

trans-unit.source: Fix compressed normal maps having different signedness on different platforms; they are now always unsigned
trans-unit.target: Fix compressed normal maps having different signedness on different platforms; they are now always unsigned

trans-unit.source: Fix Z component of normal maps when Scale & Offset is enabled
trans-unit.target: Fix Z component of normal maps when Scale & Offset is enabled

trans-unit.source: Fix NaN values in normal mapping which caused glitches in post effects
trans-unit.target: Fix NaN values in normal mapping which caused glitches in post effects

trans-unit.source: Fix shadow map range computation that caused parts of the scene not to be lit
trans-unit.target: Fix shadow map range computation that caused parts of the scene not to be lit

trans-unit.source: Reenable shadow cascade blending when automatic depth range computation is enabled and reduce the region of blending
trans-unit.target: Reenable shadow cascade blending when automatic depth range computation is enabled and reduce the region of blending

trans-unit.source: Fix invalid IL that prevented building UWP apps in release mode
trans-unit.target: Fix invalid IL that prevented building UWP apps in release mode

trans-unit.source: Version 1.9.3-beta
trans-unit.target: Version 1.9.3-beta

trans-unit.source: Release date 2017/1/11
trans-unit.target: Release date 2017/1/11

trans-unit.source: Enhancement
trans-unit.target: Enhancement

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Maintaining ALT key down while moving an entity to a different parent will now keep its absolute position/orientation/scale
trans-unit.target: Maintaining ALT key down while moving an entity to a different parent will now keep its absolute position/orientation/scale

trans-unit.source: Display the current version of Xenko in the Project Selection window
trans-unit.target: Display the current version of Xenko in the Project Selection window

trans-unit.source: Add more logging messages when creating a new project
trans-unit.target: Add more logging messages when creating a new project

trans-unit.source: Improve tab header presentation, allow to see all open editors at once
trans-unit.target: Improve tab header presentation, allow to see all open editors at once

trans-unit.source: Engine
trans-unit.target: Engine

trans-unit.source: Animation: UpdateEngine (used by animation system to update values) will skip updating values if target is an array or list (i.e. list of bones) whose size is not big enough. This was previously leading to memory corruption.
trans-unit.target: Animation: UpdateEngine (used by animation system to update values) will skip updating values if target is an array or list (i.e. list of bones) whose size is not big enough. This was previously leading to memory corruption.

trans-unit.source: Issues fixed
trans-unit.target: Issues fixed

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Fix issues with collection properties in the property grid.
trans-unit.target: Fix issues with collection properties in the property grid.

trans-unit.source: Fix an issue where thumbnail backgrounds get dark when in Gamma rendering pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Fix an issue where thumbnail backgrounds get dark when in Gamma rendering pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Fix some broken cases when clearing the archetype of an asset
trans-unit.target: Fix some broken cases when clearing the archetype of an asset

trans-unit.source: Fix a crash when dropping an object into the viewport
trans-unit.target: Fix a crash when dropping an object into the viewport

trans-unit.source: Fix many crashes and issues occurring when moving or duplicating entities and folders in the entity tree of a scene or a prefab
trans-unit.target: Fix many crashes and issues occurring when moving or duplicating entities and folders in the entity tree of a scene or a prefab

trans-unit.source: Fix some issues with selection of entities
trans-unit.target: Fix some issues with selection of entities

trans-unit.source: Fix issues with some pane of the editor not being visible while they were checked as visible in the View menu
trans-unit.target: Fix issues with some pane of the editor not being visible while they were checked as visible in the View menu

trans-unit.source: Prevent TreeViews to change scroll position when selecting an item if they were scrolled to another position while they didn't have the focus
trans-unit.target: Prevent TreeViews to change scroll position when selecting an item if they were scrolled to another position while they didn't have the focus

trans-unit.source: Fix properties that were all grayed when selecting multiple objects.
trans-unit.target: Fix properties that were all grayed when selecting multiple objects.

trans-unit.source: Fix a case where Script assets would not open in the external text editor.
trans-unit.target: Fix a case where Script assets would not open in the external text editor.

trans-unit.source: Particles
trans-unit.target: Particles

trans-unit.source: Fix a bug where Edge and Center definitions for trail shape renderer were swapped
trans-unit.target: Fix a bug where Edge and Center definitions for trail shape renderer were swapped

trans-unit.source: Fix a bug where None for particle material still displays color
trans-unit.target: Fix a bug where None for particle material still displays color

trans-unit.source: Physics
trans-unit.target: Physics

trans-unit.source: Fix 2D boxes shapes collisions.
trans-unit.target: Fix 2D boxes shapes collisions.

trans-unit.source: Fix drawing of Characters debug shapes at run-time.
trans-unit.target: Fix drawing of Characters debug shapes at run-time.

trans-unit.source: Throwing if mass is negative.
trans-unit.target: Throwing if mass is negative.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue with scaling and single collider shapes
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue with scaling and single collider shapes

trans-unit.source: Audio
trans-unit.target: Audio

trans-unit.source: Fix XAudio audio clipping when sounds were not looped.
trans-unit.target: Fix XAudio audio clipping when sounds were not looped.

trans-unit.source: Fix OpenSLES multiple play of non looped sound.
trans-unit.target: Fix OpenSLES multiple play of non looped sound.

trans-unit.source: Improvements
trans-unit.target: Improvements

trans-unit.source: Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Game Studio

trans-unit.source: Normal maps and Grayscale textures will now appear as 3-channel textures in the thumbnails and the preview.
trans-unit.target: Normal maps and Grayscale textures will now appear as 3-channel textures in the thumbnails and the preview.

trans-unit.source: Connection Router
trans-unit.target: Connection Router

trans-unit.source: Due to the way adb was spawning a daemon process, connection router port was locked due to socket handle inheritability. This is now properly disabled.
trans-unit.target: Due to the way adb was spawning a daemon process, connection router port was locked due to socket handle inheritability. This is now properly disabled.

trans-unit.source: Known Issues
trans-unit.target: Known Issues

trans-unit.source: On Linux, when switching the underlying Graphics Platform, rendering will not occur or fail. Delete the cache, local and roaming folder on the Linux host and restarting the game should fix the issue.
trans-unit.target: On Linux, when switching the underlying Graphics Platform, rendering will not occur or fail. Delete the cache, local and roaming folder on the Linux host and restarting the game should fix the issue.

trans-unit.source: Performance issues on mobile (being worked on)
trans-unit.target: Performance issues on mobile (being worked on)

trans-unit.source: On iOS if Enable device-specific builds is toggled on (from the project properties) it won't be possible to debug game code. Please manually select the architecture of your device from the Advanced tab to speed up your development.
trans-unit.target: On iOS if Enable device-specific builds is toggled on (from the project properties) it won't be possible to debug game code. Please manually select the architecture of your device from the Advanced tab to speed up your development.
